Posts.Content: Oct 10, 2017 04:10AM Lala-44 wrote: just to update: I’ve had an MRI which shows nothing but a fibroadenoma and was rated at biraids 1 In right breast and 2 in second. I went back to breast surgeon and he doesn’t seem concerned and won’t biopsy. The Dermo said it looks more like exzema of the nipple since I have eczema in other areas on my chest. The nipple is still itchy at times, it also flakes as if it seems dry. The flaking is super minimal and only in one spot. The breast surgeon also took samples of the breast discharge that I have from both breasts. It looks like milk that never dried up from when I had a baby 17 months ago, only happens when expressed.So that was put on a slide and sent to patholog to check for abnormal cells. Again , no one will biopsy the nipple ... the skin flaking is new so I’ll see how this plays out and if it continues then I’ll demand a biopsy.

Posts.Title: Intense breast itching for months venuss9 Pearljammed81

Posts.Content: Nov 16, 2017 10:48PM Lala-44 wrote: my understanding is that an MRI is much more sensitive. However IBC is often diagnosed with a biopsy. Often the MRI will show swelling or layers of malignancy often in a “nest”. What’s reassuring for you is that aside from it being rare, it doesn’t come and go. Once it starts it becomes progressively worse and worse. There was one woman on here that had IBC and it took one year to diagnose since it seemed “minor” in terms of irritation and swelling. If I were you I would definitely want to get to the bottom of the swelling, that isn’t normal and it can’t be hormonal on one side! If your problems persist despite clear imaging, don’t be afraid to push and push for answers x
Posts.Title: Not diagnosed with IBC, but I'm concerned about my breast Amyperry Amyperry

Posts.Content: 9 hours ago Lala-44 wrote: I have had several. They were just that. Fibroadenomas. At first I felt as you did and they recommended 6 month follow up. I wasn’t comfortable with that so I went after 3 months. There was no change therefore it was a B9. It stayed for years, same size and was seen in every breast ultrasound until it vanished last year. I wouldn’t jump to a biopsy right away I would wait 3 months and go back and see if there has been growth. I got several opinions and no one wanted to biopsy from get go. Depends on what you feel comfortable with
